404.title: Page not found!
404.description: Sorry, but the page you were looking for could not be found.

hero.title: Foret
hero.subtitle: Foret is open source design system for building web applications related to nature with Foret design language.

intro.description1: The Foret Design System is a personal project started to experience the creation of a design system.
intro.description2: First, I needed a brand before building a design system. Since I was always interested in nature, I created a fake brand called Foret, which has a mission of 'creating a green space within the living area for modern people in the city.'
intro.description3: After creating the brand, I defined design principles that serve as guidelines to follow when approaching the design system. Within the design principles, I selected basic elements of the design system such as color and font that match the brand, and developed UI components based on them.

hero.title: Get Started
hero.subtitle1: The Foret Design System is served both React and Angular.
hero.subtitle2: Head over to Frameworks for all the information you need to get started.

installation.title: Installation
installation.description1: Foret components are served as an
installation.description2: . Add them to your project by running:
installation.installEmotionCore: Don’t forget to install the @emotion/core ^10.0.0 also.

contributing.title: Contributing
contributing.description1: We want to provide only components of the highest quality. We can’t do that without your feedback. If you have any suggestions or any issues about what we can do to improve components, please create an issue or submit a pull request at

hero.title: Color
hero.subtitle1: Color is a fundamental component of the design system and represents brand.

hero.title: Design Principle
hero.subtitle1: Design principles define and convey the key features of the design system.
hero.subtitle2: The Foret Design System is built on the following design principles.

designPrinciple.principle2Description: Not only should it look comfortable in appearance, it should also feel comfortable in usability.
designPrinciple.principle3Description: It must not splash. The role of each design element should be taken for granted and naturally.

hero.title: Components
hero.subtitle1: Components are the building blocks of the design system.
hero.subtitle2: And it is designed to solve a specific UI problem.

button.title: Button
button.description: A button is an interactive element that results in an action described on it.

notes.description: All alphabets are transformed to uppercase.

button.disabled: If set to true, the button would be disabled.

checkbox.title: Checkbox
checkbox.description: A checkbox is used when a user to pick multiple options from a list. Users can select 0, 1, or any number of options.

checkboxGroup.disabled: If set to true, every checkbox in checkbox group would be disabled.
checkboxGroup.onChange: Callback function to invoke when the user clicks on the checkbox.

checkbox.id: The id of a checkbox. It's used to identifies the checkbox.
checkbox.checked: If set to true, the checkbox would be checked.

toggle.title: Toggle
toggle.description: A toggle is used to quickly switch between two possible states. They are commonly used for “on/off” switches.

toggle.id: The id of toggle. It's used to identifies the toggle.
toggle.disabled: If set to true, the toggle would be disabled.
